question: [File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/lib.rs] [Function: multiexp()] [DoS] If straus() or pippenger() panic due to internal assertions at lines 187-188, could this halt all signature generation and freeze the validator? (Critical)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/lib.rs] [Function: multiexp()] [Zeroization] Does multiexp properly zeroize sensitive scalar data after computation, or could the pairs slice retain references to FROST signing shares? (Critical)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/lib.rs] [Function: multiexp()] [Side-Channel] Does the match statement at line 183 have constant-time behavior, or could algorithm selection itself leak information about the number of participants? (Low)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/lib.rs] [Function: multiexp()] [Correctness] If pairs contains duplicate points with different scalars, does multiexp correctly sum them, or could point equality checks cause errors? (Medium)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/lib.rs] [Function: multiexp()] [Integer Overflow] When computing pairs[0].1 * pairs[0].0 at line 185, can scalar multiplication overflow for edge-case scalar values near field modulus? (Low)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/lib.rs] [Function: multiexp_vartime()] [Side-Channel] Is multiexp_vartime ever called with secret scalars like FROST shares, making the variable-time execution a critical side-channel vulnerability? (Critical)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/lib.rs] [Function: multiexp_vartime()] [Correctness] Does multiexp_vartime produce identical results to multiexp for all inputs, or could rounding differences cause signature verification failures? (High)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/lib.rs] [Function: multiexp_vartime()] [DoS] Can timing differences in vartime execution be exploited to DoS validators by sending inputs that trigger worst-case performance? (Medium)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/lib.rs] [Function: multiexp_vartime()] [Mixed Usage] If constant-time multiexp() and variable-time multiexp_vartime() are mixed in the same signing session, could this create partial leakage of secret scalars? (High)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [Memory Exhaustion] At line 15, allocating 2^window elements per pair could cause OOM when window=8 and pairs.len() is large (e.g., >1000 validators). Is this a DoS vector? (High)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [Integer Overflow] Can 2_usize.pow(window.into()) at line 15 overflow when window >= 64, causing incorrect allocation size and heap corruption? (Medium)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [Correctness] Does initializing all table entries to identity at line 15 correctly handle the zero scalar case in multiexponentiation? (Low)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [Side-Channel] Does the accumulator loop at lines 17-20 have constant iterations regardless of input, or could the loop bound leak information about point order? (Medium)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [Correctness] At line 18, repeatedly adding pair.1 to accum could accumulate rounding errors in certain group implementations. Could this cause signature failures? (Low)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [Memory Safety] If tables.len() is modified during iteration, could the index `p` at line 14 become invalid, causing out-of-bounds access at line 19? (Medium)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [Performance] Does precomputing full tables for all pairs cause cache thrashing that degrades performance enough to timeout FROST signing rounds? (Low)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Array Bounds] At line 43, accessing tables[s][usize::from(groupings[s][b])] could go out of bounds if groupings contains values >= 2^window. Is this validated? (High)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Zeroization] Does zeroizing groupings and tables at lines 47-48 occur after all uses, or could the compiler reorder operations exposing temporary scalar data? (High)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Correctness] At line 36, checking `b != (groupings[0].len() - 1)` assumes all groupings have same length. Could length mismatches cause incorrect doubling? (Medium)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Side-Channel] Does the double-loop at lines 37-39 execute in constant time regardless of window size, or could window selection leak information? (Medium)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [DoS] If groupings[0].len() is 0, does the reversed range at line 35 become empty, and is this handled correctly without panicking? (Low)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Side-Channel] At line 43, does indexing into tables create data-dependent memory access patterns visible through cache timing attacks? (Critical)
[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Correctness] Could integer overflow in `usize::from(groupings[s][b])` at line 43 wrap around and index the wrong table entry? (Low)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Performance] Does accumulating into res at line 43 inside nested loops cause excessive point additions that could timeout during batch signature verification? (Low)

[File: serai/crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus_vartime()] [Side-Channel] At line 68, the conditional `if groupings[s][b] != 0` creates a data-dependent branch. Could this leak scalar bits if called with secret values? (Critical)
